alert.note: Alert for Angelina (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 24 at 2:05AM CST until January 28 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 515 AM CST EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Texas, including the following counties, Angelina, Nacogdoches, San Augustine and Shelby. * WHEN...Until 515 AM CST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 205 AM CST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 3 and 5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Lufkin, Diboll, Hudson, Huntington, Etoile, Woden, Burke, Zavalla, Chireno, Broaddus, Shawnee, Homer, Dolan and Denning. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
